alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gates; Pasquotank; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Showers with gusty winds will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, northeastern Gates, and northwestern Currituck Counties, the southeastern City of Norfolk, the City of Chesapeake, the southeastern City of Portsmouth and the City of Virginia Beach through 530 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong storms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Downtown Suffolk to near Sunbury. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong storms will be near... Deep Creek around 445 PM EDT. Chesapeake and Cradock around 450 PM EDT. Portsmouth around 455 PM EDT. Virginia Wesleyan University around 500 PM EDT. Great Bridge and Norfolk around 505 PM EDT. Fentress around 510 PM EDT. Kempsville, Regent University and Princess Anne around 515 PM EDT. Virginia Beach around 525 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Norfolk, Horseshoe, Rudee Heights, Portlock, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Acorn Hill, Sigma, Herberts Corner and Oceana NAS. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina.
